name: Grave Stormborne
base_text_1: Sparkshot (When attacking a patroller, deals 1 damage to an adjacent patroller.)
mid_text_1: Readiness (Doesn't exhaust to attack, but can only attack once per turn.)
max_text_1: Max Level: Put a sword rune on this.
max_text_2: ⤵, Remove a sword rune → Destroy a unit or hero. ◎

rulings.ruling: You can't activate his max level ability while attacking and he can't attack if he's exhausted. So if you want to attack and use his ability in the same turn, you generally have to attack first, and then use his ability after he finishes attacking. If he can't survive an attack, you'll have to pick which one you want to do.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Setsuki Hiruki
base_text_1: While Setsuki isn't patrolling, opponents must pay ① each time they would attack her.
mid_text_1: Attacks: Swift strike this turn. (Deals combat damage before units and heroes without swift strike.)
max_text_1: Upkeep: Draw 2 cards.

rulings.ruling: It's ok to have more than 5 cards in your hand. When you reach the discard/draw phase, you'll still have to discard your hand, and draw that many cards + 2, capped at 5.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Garus Rook
mid_text_1: Unstoppable by patrol zones with only one patroller.
max_text_1: Two Lives (If this would die, heal all damage on it and put a crumbling rune on it instead. While it has a crumbling rune, it can really die.)

rulings.ruling: If this doesn't have a crumbling rune on it and it would die, it doesn't actually die so nothing that triggers on "dies" will happen. For example, it won't draw a card if it "would die" in the technician slot, only when it really does die after it has a crumbling rune on it.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Bigby Hayes
base_text_1: Stash (You may keep a card during the draw/discard step. If you do, draw one card less.)
mid_text_1: ⤵ → Sideline a tech 0 or I patroller. (Move it out of the patrol zone.) ◎
max_text_1: ⤵ → Draw a card.

rulings.ruling: An example of how stash works. Normally (without stash), if you have 2 cards left in hand when you reach the discard/draw phase, you'd discard both cards and then draw 4 cards (you draw 2 more than you discard). If you have stash, instead of discarding both cards, you can choose to keep one of them in your hand. If you do, you will STILL end up with 4 cards total, but you'll be drawing 3 cards rather than 4 (the 4th card is the one you kept).
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: General Onimaru
mid_text_1: Readiness (Doesn't exhaust to attack, but can only attack once per turn.)
max_text_1: Max Level: Summon three 1/1 blue soldier tokens with sparkshot.

name: Sirus Quince
base_text_1: Arrives: Summon a 0/1 blue Mirror Illusion token.
mid_text_1: ② → One of your Mirror Illusions becomes a copy of another tech 0, I, or II unit. It's still an Illusion. Trash it at end of turn.
max_text_1: Whenever a non-token unit of yours arrives, you may make one of your Mirrors an Illusion copy of it. Trash that token when Quince or its original leaves.

rulings.ruling: Copying something copies the printed version of the card and does not copy any modifiers. For example, if you copy a 2/2 that has a +1/+1 rune on it and Spirit of the Panda attached to it, the copy will just be a 2/2.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If an effect changes the "printed" values of a card, the new values will be used. This includes Chaos Mirror and transformation effects such as Polymorph: Squirrel.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: For both middle ability and max level ability, the copy is an Illusion. That means, for example, if you copy a unit of type Squirrel or Mystic then the copy will be an Illusion Squirrel or an Illusion Mystic. It will still count as a Squirrel or Mystic, and it also counts as an Illusion. Because it's an Illusion, it dies if its targeted.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you use the middle ability or max level ability to make of your Mirror Illusions a copy of something else, you can't use either of those abilities again the same turn on that same Illusion. The reason is that the ability refers to your "Mirror Illusion" but after your Mirror Illusion copies a Squirrel, for example, you have an Illusion Squirrel, not a Mirror Illusion. You can use these abilities on ANOTHER Mirror Illusion you control though.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Mirror Illusions that are copying something else DO still count toward your limit of 2 Mirror Illusion tokens.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: The max level ability says that when you use it to make one of your Mirror Illusions copy something, you must trash it when Quince or the thing it copied leaves. This does NOT have anything to do with Mirror Illusions that have not yet copied anything. Mirror Illusions that haven't copied anything do NOT get trashed when Quince leaves.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Quince's middle ability trashes the Mirror Illusion only once at the end of the turn you use the ability.
rulings.author: sharpo

rulings.ruling: Quince's max level ability can try to trash the Mirror Illusion two times, once when Quince leaves and once when the unit copied by the Mirror Illusion leaves.
rulings.author: sharpo

rulings.ruling: If your Mirror Illusion copies a Tech 1 unit, it becomes Tech 1.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Vandy Anadrose
base_text_1: Sparkshot (When attacking a patroller, deals 1 damage to an adjacent patroller.)
mid_text_1: Resist 1
mid_text_2: ①, ⤵, Discard a card → Fetch a Demonology spell from your codex, reveal it, then put it in your hand.
max_text_1: Max Level: Give +2/+2 to one friendly and one opposing tech 0 or I unit. They lose +2/+2 and die at your next upkeep.

rulings.ruling: The max level ability is not optional, so you must try to do as much as you can when she reaches max level. If you don't have a friendly tech 0 or I unit, you still must try to give the bonus to an opposing tech 0 or I unit, and vice versa.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: The units targeted by the max level ability will still lose the bonus and die during Vandy's owner's next upkeep, even if Vandy isn't around.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Orpal Gloor
base_text_1: Deals damage to units and heroes in the form of -1/-1 runes.
mid_text_1: Sacrifice a non-Demon unit → Put a -1/-1 rune on a unit. ◎
max_text_1: The first time a unit with a -1/-1 rune dies each turn, the active player puts a -1/-1 rune on two units friendly to the dead unit. ◎

rulings.ruling: Even though this deals damage in the form of -1/-1 runes, it still counts as "dealing combat damage" and anything that checks if it died to combat damage, such as Brave Knight, see getting hit by this and immediately dying as "dying from combat damage."
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Garth Torken
base_text_1: ① → Summon a 1/1 black Skeleton token. Once-per-turn.
mid_text_1: Sacrifice a Skeleton → Draw a card.
max_text_1: Max Level: You may put a tech I or II unit that costs ⑤ or less from your discard pile into play if you meet the tech reqs for it.

rulings.ruling: "Meeting the tech reqs for it" means that you control the correct tech building. For example, if you want to put a Disease tech II unit into play using the max level ability, you must have a Disease tech II building.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: When you put a unit into play using the max level ability, you don't pay for the unit.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Captain Zane
base_text_1: Haste (Can attack and play ⤵ abilities the turn he arrives.)
mid_text_1: Whenever Zane kills a scavenger, get ①.
mid_text_2: Whenever Zane kills a technician, draw a card.
max_text_1: Max level: Shove a patroller to an empty slot in its patrol zone, then deal 1 damage to it. ◎

rulings.ruling: Zane's middle ability requires ZANE to kill a scavenger or technician to get a bonus. If Zane himself kills them in combat or if Zane uses the damage from his max level ability, that counts. If another unit or hero kills them, or if Zane uses a spell to kill them, that does not count.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Shoving a patroller to another slot means removing it from the slot its in and putting it in an empty slot in that same patrol zone. It doesn't matter if slots in between are occupied or not.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If all of an opponent's patrol slots are full, there's nowhere to shove a patroller. If you try, it won't go anywhere but you'll still deal 1 damage to it because of the "do as much as you can" rule.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Drakk Ramhorn
base_text_1: Dies: Deal 1 damage to each opponent's base. ◎
mid_text_1: Your units get Frenzy 1 (+1 ATK on your turn.)
max_text_1: The first unit that arrives from your hand each turn gets haste.

rulings.ruling: If a unit arrives from your hand, then after that you control a max level Drakk, then another unit arrives from your hand, NEITHER of those units will get haste from Drakk's max level ability. The second one won't because his ability only ever cares about the first unit per turn that arrives from your hand. The first one in this example also doesn't because you didn't have a max level Drakk when you played that unit, and Drakk's ability can't retroactively grant haste to units you played earlier in the turn.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: There are many ways to get units other than "arriving from your hand." If you play a spell from your hand that summons units, such as Murkwood Allies, that does not count as the unit "arriving from your hand." If you play a unit and it goes to an opponent's Jail, then play another unit so your first unit arrives from Jail, it never "arrived from your hand." If you play a forecasted unit, it goes to the future, then it later arrives from that zone, so it never "arrived from your hand" either. You can get units in these various ways and still have Drakk's max level ability trigger that turn once you finally have a unit actually arrive from your hand for the first time that turn.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Though the unit must "arrive from your hand" to benefit from Drakk's max level ability, it doesn't have to be PLAYED from hand. Feral Strike and Skeletal Lord's ability, for example, "put something into play" from your hand. Even though that's different from "playing" those things, Drakk's ability still does work because they "arrived from your hand."
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: In 2v2 (Two-Headed Dragon) games, each team only has one base. If Draak dies, he'll deal just one damage to the other team's base.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Drakk's max level ability grants Haste to units permanently.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Jaina Stormborne
base_text_1: Sparkshot (When attacking a patroller, deals 1 damage to an adjacent patroller.)
mid_text_1: ⤵ → Deal 1 damage to a patrolling unit or building. ◎
max_text_1: ⤵ → Deal 3 damage to a unit or building. ◎

name: Master Midori
mid_text_1: Your units with no abilities get +1/+1.
max_text_1: During your turn: Flying

rulings.ruling: "Units with no abilities" means units that don't have any ability text at all. Keywords such as haste, swift strike, resist 1, frenzy 1, etc. do count as abilities. If an effect changes a units stats, such as giving it +1/+1, that does not count as an ability. If a unit has damage on it, or +1/+1 runes, or any other type of rune, that does not count as having an ability. Illusions have the property that they die when they are targeted, but they have no actual ability saying this (just help text), so an Illusion with no ability does get Midori's bonus.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If a unit gets an ability, such as Calamandra giving it resist 1, then it loses +2/+2 from Midori. This could cause it to die if it then has 0 or less HP.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Units do not lose the benefit of Midori's midband ability for being in any patrol slot.
rulings.author: sharpo

rulings.ruling: You can only reduce the gold cost of something to 0, not lower than that.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Calamandra Moss
base_text_1: Discard two cards → Calamandra gets stealth this turn.
mid_text_1: Your units get resist 1 (Opponents must pay ① each time they would ◎ them with a spell or ability.)
max_text_1: ④, ⤵ → Search your codex for a tiger unit and put it into play.

rulings.ruling: When her max level ability "puts a Tiger into play," that means you don't pay for the Tiger and you don't have to have the appropriate tech building for it either.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Argagarg Garg
base_text_1: Arrives: Summon a 0/1 green Wisp token.
mid_text_1: ⤵ → Give a unit +1 ATK/+1 armor this turn. ◎
max_text_1: Max Level: Summon a 3/3 blue Water Elemental token with anti-air.

name: Prynn Pasternaak
base_text_2: Attacks: Put a time rune on this.
mid_text_1: Dies from fading: Opponents skip their next draw/discard step (they keep their hand cards).
max_text_1: Remove two time runes → Trash a unit. ◎
max_text_2: Leaves: Return all cards to play that Pasternaak trashed.

rulings.ruling: She fades away when her last time rune is removed for any reason. Removing the last rune with the Time Spiral spell or her own max level ability will cause her to die.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: "Dies from fading" means that the last time rune she had was removed because the fading ability said to do that during the upkeep. It doesn't trigger if something else removed her last time rune.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If she has exactly two time runes, she CAN use her max level ability to trash a unit. If she does, she then immediately dies because of hanving no fading runes, then the trashed unit returns to play. This does not count as "dies from fading" on her middle ability, because that only triggers if fading itself removed the last time rune.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: When her max level ability returns a unit to play, it returns under the control of whoever controlled it when it was trashed.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: When her max level ability returns a unit to play, it returns in a "fresh" state. It's a new object, and no longer has any properties of the old object such as +1/+1 runes, damage, being a dance partner from Two Step, etc. It also returns ready (not exhausted) and it can't attack or use exhaust abilities unless it has haste.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Max Geiger
base_text_1: Sparkshot (When attacking a patroller, deals 1 damage to an adjacent patroller.)
mid_text_1: ⤵, Discard a card → Draw a card.
max_text_1: Max Level: You may trash a friendly unit then return it to play. ◎

rulings.ruling: When his max level ability returns a unit to play, it returns under the control of whoever controlled it when it was trashed.
rulings.author: sharpo

rulings.ruling: When his max level ability returns a unit to play, it returns in a "fresh" state. It's a new object, and no longer has any properties of the old object such as +1/+1 runes, damage, being a dance partner from Two Step, etc. It also returns ready (not exhausted) and it can't attack or use exhaust abilities unless it has haste.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Vir Garbarean
base_text_1: ⓪ → Look at the top card of your draw pile.
base_text_2: ① → Exchange the top card of your draw pile with a card from your hand.
mid_text_1: ⤵ → Play the top card of your draw pile. (You still pay for it and must meet the reqs for it.)
max_text_1: Max Level: Summon a 6/7 purple Mech token with forecast 2 that's untargetable. (It will arrive in two turns.)

rulings.ruling: If you have no draw pile, looking at the top card of your draw pile does nothing. It does NOT cause you to shuffle your discard pile into your draw pile.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you have no draw pile, you can't "exchange the top card of your draw pile with a card from your hand." Nothing happens.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: The max level ability summons a Mech token that has two time runes on it. Remove one time rune each of your upkeeps. When you remove the last, th Mech arrives. The Mech does not have haste so it can't attack the turn it arrives.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Troq Bashar
mid_text_1: Attacks: Deal 1 damage to that opponent's base. ◎
max_text_1: Readiness (Doesn't exhaust to attack, but can only attack once per turn.)

rulings.ruling: When Troq attacks something, his middle ability is saying to deal 1 damage to the base controlled by the same player who controls the thing he's attacking.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: River Montoya
mid_text_1: ⤵ → Sideline a tech 0 or tech I patroller. (Move it out of the patrol zone.) ◎
max_text_1: Your tech 0 units cost ① less to play.

rulings.ruling: You can only reduce the gold cost of something to 0, not lower than that.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Wrecking Ball
rules_text_1: Deal 2 damage to a building.
flavor_text: Wrecked.

name: The Boot
rules_text_1: Destroy a tech 0 or tech I unit. (Heroes aren't units.)
flavor_text: When you get the boot, you're out.

rulings.ruling: When a unit is "destroyed" it will go to its owner's discard pile and also "die" as a consequence of that. Anything that triggers on "dies" such as the patrol zone's scavenger and technician slots, or a Soul Stone, will trigger.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Intimidate
rules_text_1: Give a unit or hero -4 ATK this turn.
flavor_text: Ready to fight now??

rulings.ruling: 0 is the lowest ATK a unit can have.

name: Final Smash
rules_text_1: Destroy a tech 0 unit, return a tech I unit to its owner's hand, and gain control of a tech II unit.
flavor_text: Troq Smash!

rulings.ruling: You "do as much as you can" when playing this. For example, if there is no tech 0 in play, you still do the rest of the spell.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: The effects are not optional. If the only tech 0 unit in play is yours, you must destroy it. If the only tech I unit in play is yours, you must return it to its owner's hand. If the only tech II unit in play is yours, you "gain control of it" which does nothing.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: You choose targets as you resolve each part of the spell, not all at once before you do anything. That means if there's an opposing flagbearer in play that CAN be targeted by the first part of the spell (destroy a tech 0 unit) then you must target it. Then after that, if there is an opposing flagbearer that CAN be targeted by the second part of the spell (return a tech I unit to its owner's hand) AND you didn't already target it earlier in resolving this same cast of Final Smash, then you MUST target it. Then you resolve the last part of the spell (gain control of a tech II unit) and again, if there is an opposing flagbearer that you can choose AND you haven't chosen one already, then you must choose it.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Iron Man
flavor_text: "I'm Iron Man."

name: Revolver Ocelot
rules_text_1: Sparkshot (When attacking a patroller, deals 1 damage to an adjacent patroller.)
flavor_text: What's an ocelot, anyway?

name: Hired Stomper
rules_text_1: Arrives: Deal 3 damage to a unit. (Heroes aren't units.)
flavor_text: "Ragoroggggg! Hssssss!"

name: Regular-sized Rhinoceros
flavor_text: As rhinoceroses go, this rhinoceros is a similar size to most rhinoceroses.

name: Sneaky Pig
rules_text_1: Haste
rules_text_2: Arrives: Gets stealth this turn. (Can sneak past patrollers if that opponent has no detector.)
flavor_text: Have you ever seen a sneaky pig? Exactly.

name: Eggship
rules_text_1: Flying (Can fly over ground patrollers. Ground forces without anti-air can't attack this or deal combat damage to it when attacked.)
flavor_text: This somewhat-safe mode of transportation has been converted to a warship.

name: Harvest Reaper
rules_text_1: Overpower (Excess combat damage this would deal to a patroller hits something else this could attack.)
flavor_text: It reaps the fields. It reaps you.

name: Trojan Duck
rules_text_1: Obliterate 2 (Whenever this attacks, destroy the defender's two lowest tech units first.)
rules_text_2: Arrives or attacks: Deal 4 damage to a building.
flavor_text: This weapon of war was disguised as a gift. It didn't fool many.

rulings.ruling: Obliterate never targets units in Codex, so it can work even on units that are untargetable. The ability that deals 4 damage to a building does target the building, so it can't hit Fox's Den School (unless you have a detector) or Hero's Monument, for example.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: "Arrives or attacks:" means you get the effect when it arrives, AND you also get the effect each time it attacks. You don't have to choose.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Harmony
rules_text_1: Channeling (Stays in play. Sacrifice it when you lose your Finesse hero.)
rules_text_2: Whenever you play a spell, summon a 0/1 neutral Dancer token (limit: 3).
rules_text_3: Sacrifice Harmony → "Stop the music." (Your Dancers will flip over!)

rulings.ruling: Harmony does not trigger itself when you play it. You have to play another spell after Harmony in order to get your first Dancer token.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: You can't target the Dancer token Harmony summons with the very same spell that triggered Harmony. For example, if you play Bloom to give a unit +1/+1, that will cause Harmony to give you a new Dancer token, but you must completely resolve Bloom BEFORE you even get the new Dancer token.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you lose your Finesse hero, that forces you to sacrifice Harmony. This does NOT count as paying the cost to "Stop the music" so this will not cause your Dancers to flip over to become Angry Dancers.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: The purpose of "stopping the music" is to flip over any Dancers you control. Doing this transforms them to Angry Dancers.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Discord
rules_text_1: Give all of an opponent's tech 0 and I units -2/-1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: CLANG!

rulings.ruling: If a unit with only 1 HP is affected by this, it will die (because it has 0 HP) even if it had armor.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Two Step
rules_text_1: Channeling (Stays in play. Sacrifice it when you lose your Finesse hero.)
rules_text_2: Two of your units become dance partners if they aren't partnered already. While you control both, they each get +2/+2. If you lose one, sacrifice Two Step.
flavor_text: The two units had a special time together.

rulings.ruling: If a unit is already a dance partner from Two Step, you can't legally target it by playing another Two Step.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: "If you lose one" means if one of your partnered units leaves play or leaves your control.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Appel Stomp
rules_text_1: Sideline a patroller (move it out of the patrol zone), draw a card, then you may put Appel Stomp on top of your draw pile.
flavor_text: "Appel" is a kind of stomp in fencing. Apples are different.

rulings.ruling: If you choose not to put Appel Stomp on top of your draw pile, it will go to your discard pile.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Nimble Fencer
rules_text_1: Your virtuosos have haste. (Can attack and ⤵ the turn they arrive.)
flavor_text: "En Garde!"
pedantry: Fix haste reminder text to not use symbol?

rulings.ruling: Nimble Fencer herself is a Virtuoso, so her ability grants herself haste.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Star-Crossed Starlet
rules_text_1: Upkeep: This takes 1 damage.
rules_text_2: This gets +1 ATK for each damage on her.
flavor_text: "Now's your time to shine."

rulings.ruling: If you have a healing effect during your upkeep from another card such as Helpful Turtle, you, as the active player, can choose the order of your upkeep effects. So you can choose to heal Star-Crossed Starlet BEFORE she takes 1 damage from her own upkeep ability in that case.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Normally, Star-Crossed Starlet can have only 1 damage on her (and therefore +1 ATK from her ability) without dying. 2 damage is enough to kill her. But if she has a +1/+1 rune on her, for example from Bloom, then she has a total of 3 HP and can therefore have 2 damage on her (and +2 ATK from her ability) without dying.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Grounded Guide
rules_text_1: Your other units get +1 ATK.
rules_text_2: Your Virtuosos get +2/+1, instead.
flavor_text: He'll teach you the fundamentals.

rulings.ruling: This effect stacks if you have two of them. For example, your Virtuosos get +4/+2 if you have two Grounded Guides.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Maestro
rules_text_1: Your virtuosos cost ⓪ to play and gain "⤵ → Deal 2 damage to a building. ◎"
flavor_text: His enthusiasm is infectious.

rulings.ruling: As usual, you can't exhaust a unit as a cost to use its ability unless you controlled that unit at the start of your turn or if it has haste. So you had to have controlled your Virtuosos at the start of your turn in order to exhaust them to do 2 damage. It doesn't matter that they got the ability in the middle of the turn and it also doesn't matter when Maestro came under your control or if Maestro has haste.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Backstabber
rules_text_1: Invisible (To opponents without a detector, this is untargetable, unattackable, and can sneak past patrollers. While patrolling, this is attackable.)
flavor_text: Don't let him slip behind you.

name: Cloud Sprite
rules_text_1: Flying (Can fly over ground patrollers. Ground forces without anti-air can't attack this or deal combat damage to it when attacked.)
flavor_text: She dances in the sky, avoiding the hassles of the ground.

name: Leaping Lizard
rules_text_1: Anti-air (Can attack fliers, but can ignore patrolling fliers. Deals combat damage to fliers it fights or that fly over this while it patrols.)
flavor_text: He can reach for the sky.

name: Blademaster
rules_text_1: Your units and heroes have swift strike. (They deal combat damage before units and heroes without swift strike.)
flavor_text: It'll be over before you know it started.

rulings.ruling: Your units and heroes only keep swift strike from Blademaster's ability while he's still in play under your control. If he leaves play or leaves your control, he won't continue to grant swift strike.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Timely Messenger
rules_text_1: Haste (Can attack and play ⤵ abilities, if he had any, the turn he arrives.)
flavor_text: "I'm never late."
pedantry: Fix haste reminder text to not use symbol?

name: Tenderfoot
flavor_text: "I practice every day. I'm rapidly improving. At this rate, I'll be a Blademaster in no time. Sometimes I have bad days though. Like last week my dog ran away."

name: Older Brother
flavor_text: "You said what about my little brother?"

name: Brick Thief
rules_text_1: Arrives or attacks: Deal 1 damage to a building and repair 1 damage from another building.
rules_text_2: Resist 1 (Opponents must pay ① each time they would ◎ this with a spell or ability.)
flavor_text: He has sometimes regretted not being a feather thief.

rulings.ruling: When his ability has you "repair 1 damage from a building", you can choose one of your own buildings that is not damaged. If you do, nothing happens to your building (your building does not get extra hit points above its max HP).
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: "Arrives or attacks:" means you get the effect when he arrives, AND you also get the effect each time he attacks. You don't have to choose.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Helpful Turtle
rules_text_1: Healing 1 (During your upkeep, heal 1 damage from all friendly units and heroes.)
flavor_text: "I'm helping."

name: Granfalloon Flagbearer
rules_text_1: Whenever an opponent plays a spell or ability that can ◎ a flagbearer, it must ◎ a flagbearer at least once.
flavor_text: "My flag flies for associations and societies based on a shared but ultimately fabricated premise, such as any company or nation."

name: Fruit Ninja
rules_text_1: Frenzy 1 (Gets +1 ATK on your turn.)
flavor_text: Quick to slice fruit. Quick to slice YOU.

name: Spark
rules_text_1: Deal 1 damage to a patroller.
flavor_text: Practice mastery of all things, large and small.

name: Bloom
rules_text_1: Put a +1/+1 rune on a friendly unit or hero that doesn't have a +1/+1 rune.
flavor_text: Bigger is better, and slightly bigger is slightly better.

name: Wither
rules_text_1: Put a -1/-1 rune on a unit or hero.

rulings.ruling: If you put the -1/-1 rune on an X/1 unit, that will unit will die (because it has 0 HP) even if it had armor.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Chaos Mirror
rules_text_1: Swap the printed ATK of two units and/or heroes until end of turn.

rulings.ruling: The printed ATK means the ATK actually printed on the card. For example, a 2/3 unit has "2" as it's printed ATK, even if it gets a +1/+1 rune and an additional +2/+2 from Two Step.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Any effects that copy a unit such as Manufactured Truth, copy only the printed version of a unit, but they will respect Chaos Mirror's swap of the printed values. For example, if you have a 1/1 and an 8/8, then swap their printed ATK with Chaos Mirror (so you have an 8/1 and a 1/8) then you copy the 8/1 with Manufactured Truth, your copy will be an 8/1.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Detonate
rules_text_1: Trash a worker or building card (not add-on), then trash this card. (Trashed cards are removed from the game, not discarded.)
pedantry: "not-addons" is awkward and not consistent with Assimilate

rulings.ruling: The point of this spell is to trash an opponent's worker or building card, but you can trash your own if you want.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: A "building card" does not mean a base, an add-on (such as the Tower or Surplus), and it does not mean your tech I, II, or III buildings. It does mean building cards that you can have in your deck such as Rickety Mine, Graveyard, Firehouse, etc.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: When you trash an opponent's worker, you don't get to choose which worker to destroy (because they're alll considered identical) and you don't get to see the front of the destroyed worker.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Surprise Attack
rules_text_1: Summon two 3/1 blue Shark tokens with haste and ephemeral. (They can attack right away but die at end of turn.)

name: Maximum Anarchy
rules_text_1: Destroy all units and heroes.

rulings.ruling: This destroys Zane himself, too.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Heroes that are destroyed go to their owner's command zone. Units that die go to their owner's discard pile.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: When a unit or hero is "destroyed" it will "die" as a consequence of that. Anything that triggers on "dies" such as the patrol zone's scavenger and technician slots, or a Soul Stone, will trigger.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Calypso Vystari
rules_text_1: ⤵ → If you played a spell this turn, sideline a patroller. (Move it out of the patrol zone.)

rulings.ruling: If you have not played a spell this turn, activating her ability does nothing. It will not even kill an Illusion in this case, because it doesn't target at all if you haven't played a spell.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: A "Spell" says "Spell" on its type line. Units, heroes, buildings, upgrades, etc. are not "spells."
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Gunpoint Taxman
rules_text_1: Anti-air (Can attack fliers, but can ignore patrolling fliers. Deals combat damage to fliers it fights or that fly over this while it patrols.)
rules_text_2: Whenever Gunpoint Taxman kills a patroller, steal ① from that player.

rulings.ruling: His ability to steal gold does nothing against an opponent that doesn't have any gold.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Disguised Monkey
rules_text_1: Haste
rules_text_2: Arrives: Gets stealth this turn (Can sneak past patrollers if that opponent has no detector.)

name: Chameleon Lizzo
rules_text_1: Haste
rules_text_2: Stealth (Can sneak past patrollers if that opponent has no detector.)
rules_text_3: At the end of turn, return Chameleon Lizzo to his owner's hand. (Return it only if it's still in play.)

rulings.ruling: He returns to your hand AFTER the draw/discard phase.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: He will return to your hand at the end of each turn. So if he's in play on your opponent's turn for some reason, he'll return to your hand after your opponent's draw/discard phase.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Marauder
rules_text_1: Boost ③ (You may pay an additional ③ when you play this to get the boost effect.)
rules_text_2: Haste
rules_text_3: Arrives: If you boosted, trash a worker.
pedantry: Boost effect should not say "Arrives:" (because of Boost+Jail ruling, but also for consistency with other Boost Units)

rulings.ruling: The point of boosting him is to trash an opponent's worker, but you could trash your own if you want.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Steam Tank
rules_text_1: +4 ATK when attacking buildings

name: Sanatorium
rules_text_1: ①, ⤵ → Draw a card. Put up to two tech 0, I and/or II units from your hand into play. Those units gain haste and ephemeral. (They die at end of turn.)

rulings.ruling: When you put units into play with this ability, you don't have to pay for them and you don't have to meet the tech requirements for them either.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: The units gain haste and ephemeral permanently. So if they don't leave play after one turn, they'll keep trying to die every turn, and Wandering Mimic will get haste from them.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Pirate Gunship
rules_text_1: Flying, haste, long-range, resist 2 (Opponents must pay ② each time they would ◎ this with a spell or ability.)
rules_text_2: Obliterate 2 (Whenever this attacks, destroy the defender's two lowest tech units first.)

name: Desperation
rules_text_1: If your hand is empty, trash this card and draw three cards. (You can only reshuffle once per main phase.)
rules_text_2: Discard your hand at the end of the main phase.

rulings.ruling: Desperation only draws cards if it's the only card in your hand before you play it. By the time it checks whether your hand it empty, it won't be in your hand anymore.
rulings.author: sharpo

rulings.ruling: You discard your hand before the draw/discard phase. So normally you'll discard your hand, then discard 0 and draw 2.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Kidnapping
rules_text_1: Gain control of an opposing tech 0, I, or II unit until end of turn. Ready it and it gets haste until end of turn.

rulings.ruling: If the unit you steal does not die (or otherwise leave play) on your turn, then whichever player you stole it from regains control of it at the end of your turn.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If the unit you steal dies while under your care, it will go to its owner's discard pile (not yours).
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Bloodlust
rules_text_1: Give up to two units and/or heroes +1 ATK and haste this turn. They each take 1 damage at end of turn.

name: War Drums
rules_text_1: Channeling (Stays in play. Sacrifice it when you lose your Blood hero.)
rules_text_2: Your units get +X ATK where X is the number of units you have.

rulings.ruling: Units you "have" refers to units you control. It does not include units you own, but that were stolen from you for some reason, and it doesn't include units that aren't in play, such as those in Jail, Graveyard, or forecasted.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Crash Bomber
rules_text_1: Dies on your turn: Deal 1 damage to a patroller or building.
rules_text_2: Dies on another player's turn: Deal 1 damage to that player's base.

name: Rickety Mine
rules_text_1: ⤵ → Gain ③ and flip a coin.
rules_text_2: Heads: Phew!
rules_text_3: Tails: Sacrifice Rickety Mine and your base takes 2 damage.

rulings.ruling: You can't use the ability the turn Rickety Mine comes under your control because it doesn't have haste.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: "Phew!" has no gameplay effect. It has a psychological effect though.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Shoddy Glider
rules_text_1: Haste, ephemeral
rules_text_2: Flying (Can fly over ground patrollers. Ground forces without anti-air can't attack this or deal combat damage to it when attacked.)

name: Captured Bugblatter
rules_text_1: Whenever a unit dies on an opponent's turn, their base takes 1 damage.
rules_text_2: Whenever a unit dies on your turn, deal 1 damage to an opponent's base.

rulings.ruling: In 2v2 (Two-Headed Dragon) games, each team only has one base. When Captured Bugblatter's triggers, it will deal just one damage to the other team's base.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: When Captured Bugblatter itself dies, its ability DOES trigger.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Crashbarrow
rules_text_1: Haste, ephemeral
rules_text_2: Overpower (Excess combat damage this would deal to a patroller hits something else this could attack.)

name: Land Octopus
rules_text_1: Overpower (Excess combat damage this would deal to a patroller hits something else this could attack.)
rules_text_2: Upkeep: Sacrifice two workers or Land Octopus.
rules_text_3: Can't patrol.

rulings.ruling: If you choose to sacrifice workers, they are trashed. They don't go to the discard pile.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Ogre Recruiter
rules_text_1: Attacks: If this survives the combat, gain control of a tech 0 or tech I unit.

name: Pirate-Gang Commander
rules_text_1: Arrives: Summon three 2/2 red Pirate tokens.
rules_text_2: Your units have "Dies: deal 1 damage to each opposing base. ◎"
rules_text_3: You may play tech I or II Blood units for free and without any tech buildings.

name: Fire Dart
rules_text_1: Deal 3 damage to a unit or 2 damage to a building.

name: Ember Sparks
rules_text_1: Deal 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three patrollers and/or buildings.

rulings.ruling: 3 damage divided as choose means it can do a) 1 damage to three things, b) 2 damage to one thing and 1 damage to another thing, or c) 3 damage to one thing.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you have the Hotter Fire upgrade, Ember Sparks can do a total of 4 damage, rather than 3. You can still only divide that damage amongst one, two, or three targets though (not four targets).
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Flame Arrow
rules_text_1: Deal 4 damage to a unit or hero or 3 damage to a building.

name: Burning Volley
rules_text_1: Deal 5 damage divides as you choose among any number of units, heroes, and/or buildings.

rulings.ruling: You must assign at least 1 damage to each target, so you can choose at most five targets.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you have the Hotter Fire upgrade, Burning Volley can do a total of 6 damage. You can then divide that damage to up to six targets.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Lobber
rules_text_1: Haste (Can attack and play ⤵ abilities the turn he arrives.)
rules_text_2: ⤵ → Deal 1 damage to a building.

name: Firebat
rules_text_1: ①, ⤵ → Deal 2 damage to a patroller or building.

name: Bamstamper Lizzo
rules_text_1: Arrives: Deal 3 damage to a unit.

rulings.ruling: The effect is not optional. If the only units in play are yours, you must choose one of those. If the only unit in play is Bamstamper Lizzo himself, he deals 3 to himself and dies.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Doubleshot Archer
rules_text_1: Long-range (Defenders without long-range deal no damage to this when it attacks.)
rules_text_2: Attacks: Deal 3 damage to that opponent's base.

name: Molting Firebird
rules_text_1: Flying
rules_text_2: Damages a building: Deal 1 damage to every unit and hero that opponent controls.

name: Firehouse
rules_text_1: ⤵ → Deal 2 damage to a unit, hero, or building. If you destroy it that way, ready this.

rulings.ruling: You can't exhaust this to use the ability the turn it comes under your control because it doesn't have haste.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Yes, you really can gun down an unlimited number of things per turn with this. When Firehouse's ability readies Firehouse, you can use it again, etc.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Firehouse cannot kill an unlimited number of Illusions. If you use it on an Illusion, that Illusion will die instantly from being targeted before it takes any damage. This will NOT ready Firehouse because the "if you destroy it this way" clause refers to you destroying it using the 2 damage specifically.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Hotter Fire
rules_text_1: Your red spells and abilities that deal damage deal 1 damage more.

rulings.ruling: This really does apply to all abilities that deal damage on all red cards and red spells that deal damage. For example, Molting Firebird deals 2 damage to every opposing unit if you have Hotter Fire. Zane's max level ability deals 2 damage to the patroller shoves. Jaina's max level ability deals 4 damage. Scorch deals 3 damage. Crash Bomber deals 2 damage when he dies. Careless Musketeer deals 2 damage to a unit or building AND 2 damage to your base, etc.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: This does not affect any red units or heroes with abilities that simply deal combat damage. For example, it doesn't increase the damage from sparkshot, overpower, or anti-air.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you have more than one Hotter Fire, the effects do stack.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Cinderblast Dragon
rules_text_1: Flying, resist 2 (Opponents must pay ② each time the would ◎ this with a spell or ability.)
rules_text_2: Arrives or attacks: You may play a non-ultimate Fire spell from your hand or codex for free. (Then discard the spell.)

rulings.ruling: You can play the Fire spell even if you don't have a Fire hero.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: The Fire spell is played after you declare what you're attacking, but before that attack actually happens. If spell kills the thing you were attacking, you choose a new thing to attack, but this does not trigger the ability a second time that turn.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Nautical Dog
rules_text_1: Frenzy 1 (Gets +1 ATK on your turn.)

name: Mad Man
rules_text_1: Haste (Can attack and play ⤵ abilities, if he had any, the turn he arrives.)

name: Bombaster
rules_text_1: ①, Sacrifice Bombaster → Deal 2 damage to a patrolling unit.

name: Careless Musketeer
rules_text_1: ⤵ → Deal 1 damage to a unit or building and 1 damage to your base.

name: Bloodrage Ogre
rules_text_1: End of turn: Return Bloodrage Ogre to his owner's hand if he didn't arrive or attack this turn.

rulings.ruling: He returns to your hand AFTER the draw/discard phase.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: The "End of Turn" ability only triggers on his controller's turn.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Makeshift Rambaster
rules_text_1: Haste (Can attack and play ⤵ abilities, if it had any, the turn it arrives.)
rules_text_2: +2 ATK when attacking buildings.
rules_text_3: Can't patrol.

name: Bloodburn
rules_text_1: Whenever a unit dies, put a blood rune on this (limit: 4).
rules_text_2: ⤵, remove two blood runes → Deal 1 damage to a unit or building.

rulings.ruling: You can't exhaust this to use the ability the turn it comes under your control because it doesn't have haste.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Scorch
rules_text_1: Deal 2 damage to a patroller or building.

name: Charge
rules_text_1: Give one of your units haste and +1 ATK this turn.

name: Pillage
rules_text_1: Deal 1 damage to a base. Steal ① from that player.
rules_text_2: If you have a Pirate, instead deal 2 damage and steal ②.

rulings.ruling: If the player has less gold than you're trying to steal, steal as much as you can. You can only gain as much gold as you actually take from the other player.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Moment's Peace
rules_text_1: Until your next turn, your units can't patrol and opposing units can't attack you.
flavor_text: The air was still. A tranquil energy surrounded them. They laid down their weapons, even though it seemed unwise.

rulings.ruling: "Can't attack you" means can't attack anything you control. For example, can't attack your base or any of your buildings, and can't attack your heroes or units.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: In 2v2, none of the other team's units can attack units, heroes, or buildings you control, including your team's base. Opposing units can still attack units, heroes and buildings your teammate controls though, except for your team's base.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Nature Reclaims
rules_text_1: Trash an upgrade, ongoing spell, or building card (not add-on), then trash this card. (Trashed cards are removed from the game, not discarded.)

rulings.ruling: A "building card" does not mean a base, an add-on (such as the Tower or Surplus), and it does not mean your tech I, II, or III buildings. It does mean building cards that you can have in your deck such as Rickety Mine, Graveyard, Firehouse, etc.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Circle of Life
rules_text_1: Sacrifice a green unit. If you do, put a green unit one tech higher that costs 5 or less from your codex into play.
flavor_text: You can't teach an old dog new tricks. Nature's solution: new dogs.

rulings.ruling: "One tech higher" means that if you sacrifice a tech 0 unit, you can get a tech I unit. If you sacrifice a tech I unit, you can get a tech II unit. If you sacrifice a tech II unit, you could get a tech III unit, except actually non green tech III units exist that cost 5 or less.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: "Cost 5 or less" refers to the printed gold cost in the upper left corner of the card. Abilities that reduce costs, such as Gigadons, aren't taken into account, so you can never get Gigadon with Circle of Life.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Final Showdown
rules_text_1: Attach to your Balance hero.
rules_text_2: He gets +3/+3, readiness, resist 1, and draws a card when he attacks.
rules_text_3: Summon two 3/3 green Hunter tokens with anti-air for an opponent, so that it's fair.

rulings.ruling: The Hunter tokens an opponent gets do not go to their patrol zone. That opponent will have to wait until their turn to patrol the Hunters.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Gemscout Owl
rules_text_1: Flying but can't attack.
rules_text_2: Resist 1
rules_text_3: Upkeep: Gain ①
flavor_text: These owls can spot a mouse a mile away and shiny treasures from two.

name: Tiny Basilisk
rules_text_1: Deathtouch (Combat damage this deals to units or heroes, even to their armor, kills them.)
rules_text_2: Tiny Basilisk is unattackable and unstoppable by tech 0 units. (Cannot be attacked by tech 0 units and can ignore tech 0 patrollers when attacking.)
flavor_text: Some overlooked it. They were better off.

name: Chameleon
rules_text_1: Stealth (Can sneak past patrollers if that opponent has no detector.)
flavor_text: It comes in and out of view as the Sun and the Moon.

name: Fairie Dragon
rules_text_1: Flying
rules_text_2: Arrives: You may put a feather rune on a tech I or II unit.
rules_text_3: Units with feather runes are 3/1 and have flying.

rulings.ruling: If Fairie Dragon leaves play, units with feather runes no longer have flying and are no longer 3/1. If a Fairie Dragon later enters play, any units with a feather rune (even from a previous Fairie Dragon) will be flying and will be 3/1.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If something such as Manufactured Truth copies a unit with a feather rune, the copy will not have the rune, will not be 3/1 and will not have flying.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Fairie Dragon only changes the "base" ATK and health of those units; runes and other effects can add or subtract ATK or health.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Units with feather runes gain flying, but don't lose any of their other abilities.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Dothram Horselord
rules_text_1: Overpower
rules_text_2: Upkeep: If a player has more total ATK than each other player, Dothram Horselord joins their forces.
flavor_text: The horselords follow only the strong.

rulings.ruling: Dothram Horselord himself counts in computing a player's total ATK.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you have control of a Dothram Horselord because Mind Control is attached, Mind Control's effect wins because it's being continuously applied. Effects that happen once (rather than continuously), such as Final Smash stealing control of unit or Community Service giving you control of an opponent's unit, DO get overridden by Dothram Horselord's ability, because newer triggers beat older triggers.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Wandering Mimic
rules_text_1: As long as a unit or hero with flying is in play, Wandering Mimic has flying. The same is true for overpower, haste, sparkshot, untargetable, and stealth.
flavor_text: Mimic see, mimic do.

rulings.ruling: If you have two Mimics that have flying because a THIRD unit has flying, but then that third unit dies, both your Mimics lose flying.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Potent Basilisk
rules_text_1: Arrives: You may destroy an upgrade or ongoing spell.
rules_text_2: Untargetable, deathtouch
flavor_text: Their gaze is deadly and their scales reflective.

name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
rules_text_1: Overpower, resist 2
rules_text_2: Arrives: Destroy up to two units, upgrades, and/or workers.
flavor_text: You can't negotiate with a T-Rex. You're lucky if you can even run.

rulings.ruling: You can destroy any two of the things listed in any combination. For example, you could destroy "one unit and one upgrade" or "two workers."
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Destroying a worker aways trashes it, NOT discards it.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: When you destroy an opponent's worker, you don't get to choose which worker to destroy (because they're all considered identical) and you don't get to see the front of the destroyed worker.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Ferocity
rules_text_1: Your units get armor piercing and swift strike until your next upkeep. (They ignore armor and deal their combat damage before units and heroes without swift strike.)
flavor_text: Nature protects herself with deadly speed and force.

name: Behind the Ferns
rules_text_1: Channeling (Stays in play. Sacrifice it when you lose your Feral hero.)
rules_text_2: Your units with 3 ATK or less have stealth. (Can sneak past patrollers if that opponent has no detector.)

rulings.ruling: If you have Behind the Ferns and a Steam Tank (3 ATK), then attack a building with Steam Tank, it still does get stealth from Behind the Ferns. The extra ATK from Steam Tank's ability kicks in after the check that lets it sneak past patrollers.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Interactions between Behind the Ferns and Midori's mid-level ability (which gives +2/+2 to units without abilities) depend on the order of events. Some examples using those cards and Overeager Cadet (a 2/2 with no ability). If you pay Ferns -> Cadet -> Midori or Cadet -> Ferns -> Midori, your Overeager Cadet will be a 2/2 with stealth. That's what he is at step 2 of those examples, so at step 3 when Midori's middle ability is involved, it will not buff Cadet because at a that point, Cadet does have an ability (stealth from Behind the Ferns). Similarly if you get Midori -> Cadet -> Ferns or Cadet -> Midori -> Ferns, the Cadet will be a 4/4 before Ferns happens, so it will stay a 4/4 with no abilities. However, if you play in this order: Ferns -> Midori -> Cadet or Midori -> Ferns -> Cadet, then the cadet is arriving while both effects already exist. In these cases it is also a 4/4 with no abilities.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Murkwood Allies
rules_text_1: Boost ④ (You may pay an additional ④ when you play this to get the boost effect.)
rules_text_2: Choose one: Summon a 4/4 green Beast token; or summon four 1/1 green Frog tokens.
rules_text_3: If you boosted, choose both.
flavor_text: When the forest is in trouble, the marshlands come to aid. All is connected.

name: Feral Strike
rules_text_1: Boost ④ (You may pay an additional ④ when you play this to get the boost effect.)
rules_text_2: Choose one: Fetch up to two units from your codex, reveal them, then put them in your hand; or put up to two units from your hand into play if you have tech buildings of the same tech level as them.
rules_text_3: If you boosted, choose both.

rulings.ruling: "If you have tech buildings of the same tech level as them" means that for tech 0 units you only need your base (which you always have if you haven't lost the game yet), for tech I units you have a tech I building, for tech II units you have a tech II building and for tech III units you have a tech III building. Your building does NOT need to be the same spec as the units. For example you could use Feral Strike to put two Blood tech II units into play, even of your tech II building was Growth spec.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Huntress
rules_text_1: Sparkshot (When attacking a patroller, deals 1 damage to an adjacent patroller.)
rules_text_2: Anti-air (Can attack fliers, but can ignore patrolling fliers. Deals combat damage to fliers it fights or that fly over this while it patrols.)

name: Centaur
rules_text_1: Overpower (Excess combat damage this would deal to a patroller hits something else this could attack.)

name: Stalking Tiger
rules_text_1: Stealth while attacking a unit.
rules_text_2: Stalking Tiger is invisible while you have a Feral hero. (To opponents without a detector, it's untargetable, unattackable, and can sneak past patrollers. While patrolling, it's attackable.)

name: Predator Tiger
rules_text_1: Predator Tiger is unstoppable by tech 0 units. (Can ignore tech 0 patrollers when attacking.)
rules_text_2: Whenever Predator Tiger deals combat damage to a base, trash a worker at that base.

name: Barkcoat Bear
rules_text_1: Resist 2 (Opponents must pay ② each time they would ◎ this with a spell or ability.)
rules_text_2: Overpower (Excess combat damage this would deal to a patroller hits something else this could attack.)
flavor_text: Bear!

name: Rampaging Elephant
rules_text_1: The first time Rampaging Elephant exhausts each turn, ready him. (He can attack again!)
flavor_text: Gentle giant? Or unstoppable force?

name: Gigadon
rules_text_1: Gigadon costs ① less to play for each green unit you have.
rules_text_2: Overpower
flavor_text: "It was huge and it came out much earlier than we expected."

rulings.ruling: Some abilities on cards like Insurance Agent or Garth Torken care about the cost of cards. Those abilities will always see Gigadon's cost as 9. Gigadon's ability only reduces the cost of playing it.
rulings.author: sharpo

rulings.ruling: You can only reduce the gold cost of something to 0, not lower than that.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Moss Ancient
rules_text_1: Untargetable
rules_text_2: Arrives or attacks: Summons three 1/1 green Squirrel tokens.
rules_text_3: Your squirrels have haste and are invisible.
flavor_text: The Ancients have watched over the lands since before our history. They are particularly king to small creatures.

rulings.ruling: Your Squirrels only keep haste and invisible from Moss Ancient's ability while he's still in play under your control. If he leaves play or leaves your control, he won't continue to grant those abilities.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Polymorph: Squirrel
rules_text_1: Transform a unit into a 1/1 green Squirrel with no abilities until your next upkeep.
flavor_text: "You could use a little perspective."

rulings.ruling: Transforming into a Squirrel does not count as a new unit entering play. No "arrive" happens here. If the unit had any baggage, such as +1/+1 runes, an ongoing spell such as a Soul Stone or Spirit of the Panda, or damage on it, all of that will still be on it when it Transforms. Though it loses all printed abilities it has and loses all one-time effects that other things might have granted it before the transform, it still benefits from one-time effects that happen to it after the transform and it still benefits from +1/+1 runes that are on it, and attachments such as Spirit of the Panda.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Transforming the unit to a 1/1 can kill it if it already had damage on it.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: This spell can kill units that usually can't be killed. Transforming an indestructible unit or Gilded Glaxx (when you have gold in your gold pile) then dealing 1 damage to the Squirrel will kill it because the Squirrel is not indestructible and does not have Gilded Glaxx's ability.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: The transformed unit is still whatever tech level it was before.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If something would copy the Squirrel such as Manufactured Truth, then the copy is a 1/1 Squirrel with no abilities. Usually, copying something copies the printed version of the card and does not copy any modifiers, but because Polymorph Squirrel "transforms" the unit, the transformed version is treated as the new thing that gets copied. If the transformed Squirrel has a +1/+1 rune and Spirit of the Panda attached, copying it will still give you only 1/1 Squirrel with no abilities.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Dinosize
rules_text_1: Give a unit or hero +6 ATK / +6 armor this turn.
flavor_text: Be careful how you treat the little ones. It might come back to bite you.

name: Spirit of the Panda
rules_text_1: Attach to a unit.
rules_text_2: Attached unit gets +2/+2 and "Attacks: Gain ①."
rules_text_3: Healing 1 (During your upkeep, heal 1 damage from all friendly units and heroes.)

name: Stampede
rules_text_1: Your units get +3 ATK / +3 armor this turn. Excess combat damage they would deal to units and heroes hits that opponent's base. (This takes precedence over overpower.)
flavor_text: Nature stops for no man.

rulings.ruling: Units that have overpower do not LOSE overpower from this spell, so a Wandering Mimic would still see those units as having the keyword. It's just that Stampedes instructions for where to send the excess damage happen, and overpower's instructions don't.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Galina Glimmer
rules_text_1: Upkeep: Gain ① for every two of your green units.
flavor_text: She inspired many to help save the forests.

rulings.ruling: Galina Glimmer herself is a green unit, so she counts in the total.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you have 3 green units, you still get only 1 gold, not 1.5 gold.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Giant Panda
rules_text_1: Arrives: Exhausted. Summon a 0/1 green Wisp token.
flavor_text: Pandas and Merfolk are long-lived and old friends.

name: Artisan Mantis
rules_text_1: Arrives: Repair 3 damage from a building.
flavor_text: The Mantii see their work as both an art and a craft; their structures are a marriage of form, function, and beauty.

rulings.ruling: If you choose a building with less than 3 damage on it, the Mantis will repair as much as he can. He won't increase the max HP of a building though, he can only remove damage already on it.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Oversized Rhinoceros
flavor_text: As rhinoceroses go, this rhinoceros is bigger than most rhinoceroses.

name: Blooming Ancient
rules_text_1: Whenever another unit or hero of yours arrives, put a +1/+1 rune on this.
rules_text_2: Remove a +1/+1 rune → Put a +1/+1 rune on another unit.
flavor_text: Its growth can really get out of control.

name: Blooming Elm
rules_text_1: Your units and heroes with +1/+1 runes have overpower.
rules_text_2: ⤵ → Put three +1/+1 runes on a unit or one on a hero if that unit or hero doesn't have any +1/+1 runes.

rulings.ruling: You can target a unit or a hero which already have +1/+1 rune(s). It just won't add more runes.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Might of Leaf and Claw
rules_text_1: Whenever you deal combat damage with an attacker, put a growth rune on this.
rules_text_2: While this has at least five growth runes, your units and heroes get +5/+5

rulings.ruling: Dealing 0 combat damage does not count as "dealing combat damage."
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you deal combat damage to something's armor, that does count as "dealing combat damage."
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Abilities like sparkshot and overpower deal damage at the same time as a thing's normal combat damage. All this damage is considered a single instance of "dealing damage," so the extra damage doesn't add a second rune.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Guargum, Eternal Sentinel
rules_text_1: Resist 2 (Opponents must pay ② each time they would ◎ this with a spell or ability.)
rules_text_2: Obliterate 4 (Whenver this attacks, destroy the defender's four lowest tech units first.)
rules_text_3: You may play Growth spells for free and without having a Growth Hero.

rulings.ruling: Guargum can even play an ultimate Growth spell for free. He can play it even if you didn't control him at the start of your turn.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Merfolk Prospector
rules_text_1: ⤵ → Gain ①.
flavor_text: Wise fish know that gold doesn't buy happiness, but it does help to have some around.

name: Tiger Cub
flavor_text: Tiger cubs spring from the bushes as they practice hunting their prey.

name: Young Treant
rules_text_1: Arrives: Draw a card.
rules_text_2: Can't attack
flavor_text: To fight a forest, you first have to get through the trees.

name: Playful Panda
rules_text_1: Arrives: Exhausted. Summon a 0/1 green Wisp token.
flavor_text: Wisps follow those who are pure of heart.

name: Ironbark Treant
rules_text_1: -2 ATK / +2 armor while patrolling. (Armor absorbs damage before HP and is then destroyed.)
flavor_text: "Let thy armies be the rocks, the trees, and the birds in the sky."

rulings.ruling: He's a 3/2 on your turn. The -2 ATK / +2 armor only happens on opponents turns and only while he's in your patrol zone. If something removes him from your patrol zone on an opponent's turn, he loses the stat adjustment.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: In a free-for-all game, if one opponent deals enough damage to remove some or all of his armor, but not kill him, he will have 2 new armor on the next opponent's turn.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Spore Shambler
rules_text_1: Arrives: Put two +1/+1 runes on this.
rules_text_2: ① or ⤵, then remove a +1/+1 rune → Put a +1/+1 rune on another unit.

rulings.ruling: Removing a +1/+1 rune can cause Spore Shambler to die if he ends up with 0 or less HP (in other words, if he has damage on him greater than or equal to his HP).
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: To pay the cost of "remove a +1/+1" rune, you must remove the rune from Spore Shambler, not from something else.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Verdant Tree
rules_text_1: Healing 1 (During your upkeep, heal 1 damage from all friendly units and heroes.)
rules_text_2: ⤵ → Your tech buildings build instantly this turn.
flavor_text: Life springs up all around this hallowed tree.

rulings.ruling: You can't use the exhaust ability the turn Verdant Tree comes under you control because it doesn't have haste.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Building tech buildings instantly means it's possible to build them all in a row in one turn. For example, you could build your tech I, then immediately build your tech II, then immediately build your tech III all in the same turn. Each tech building becomes operational right as you build it, rather than at the end of your main phase.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Rich Earth
rules_text_1: You may hire workers for free.
flavor_text: It was hardly work at all, minerals abound!

rulings.ruling: You still have to put a card from your hand into the worker zone, even though you don't have to pay gold to hire a worker. And you still can only hire one worker per turn.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If an effect increases the cost of hiring workers, you still have to pay that cost increase. For example, if something increased the cost to hire workers by 1 for all players, you'd pay 1 to hire a worker, while players without Rich Earth would pay 2 to hire workers.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Rampant Growth
rules_text_1: Give a unit or hero +2 ATK / +2 armor this turn. (Armor absorbs damage before HP and is then destroyed.)
flavor_text: They fled for their lives from the terrible RABBIT.

rulings.ruling: If the unit or hero has any armor left at the end of the turn, that armor disappears.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Forest's Favor
rules_text_1: Put a +1/+1 rune on a friendly unit or hero that doesn't have a +1/+1 rune.
flavor_text: The forest smiles upon thee.

name: Injunction
rules_text_1: Disable a level I or II tech building and all of that player's units of the same tech level. (Exhaust the units, they don't ready during their next ready step, and sideline them if they were patrolling. That building isn't operational next turn.)

rulings.ruling: If you use Injunction on an opponent's Growth tech II building, for example, this will disable any tech II units they control at that moment, even if they are of a different spec. (They might have gained control of an Anarchy tech II unit or something, or cheated in units from other specs with Feral Strike.)
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: When you disable an opponent's tech building, they cannot build the next higher tech building until the disable ends. For example, if you disable their tech II building, they cannot build a tech III building on their next turn. If they already had a tech III building though, disabling their tech II building doesn't affect their tech III building—the tech III building continues operating normally.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If an opponent does not have a tech II building, you won't be able to use Injunction to disable their tech II units.
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Community Service
rules_text_1: Look at an opponent's discard pile or hand. You may put a tech I or II unit from there into play under your control.

rulings.ruling: When you put units into play with this, you don't have to pay for them and you don't have to meet the tech requirements for them either.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Jurisdiction
rules_text_1: Play any non-ultimate spell from your codex. (You still pay its cost to play it, then discard it.)

rulings.ruling: If you use this to play a channeling spell such as Two Step, but you don't control the appropriate hero to channel that spell, it's immediately discarded.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Judgment Day
rules_text_1: Your max level Law hero can cast this no matter when he arrived or maxed.
rules_text_2: Destroy all tech 0, I, and II units. (Heroes aren't units. Tokens are tech 0.)

rulings.ruling: When a unit is "destroyed" it will "die" as a consequence of that. Anything that triggers on "dies" such as the patrol zone's scavenger and technician slots, or a Soul Stone, will trigger. When units die, they go to their owner's discard pile.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Tax Collector
rules_text_1: Arrives: Steal ① from an opponent.

rulings.ruling: His ability does nothing against an opponent that doesn't have any gold.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Scribe
rules_text_1: Arrives: Draw a card.

name: Guardian of the Gates
rules_text_1: Can't attack.
rules_text_2: Whenever Guardian of the Gates deals combat damage to a unit, disable it. (Exhaust it and it doesn't ready during its next ready step.)

rulings.ruling: Guardian of the Gates disables the unit he deals combat damage to, not himself.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If Guardian of the Gates deals combat damage to a unit with armor and the armor absorbs all the damage, his ability still triggers.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Insurance Agent
rules_text_1: Arrives: Put an insurance rune on a unit. When that insured unit dies, gain gold equal to its gold cost and draw a card.

rulings.ruling: If you use the ability on an Illusion, the Illusion immediately dies when targeted, never gets an insurance rune, and is thus never considered "insured." You don't get gold when it dies.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If Insurance Agent dies, his effect is no longer active. The insurance rune on his target now does nothing, even if you play a new Insurance Agent. The new Insurance Agent will place a new insurance rune on something, but he won't interact with the previous rune because of the "that unit" phrase on the ability.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If the unit with the insurance rune leaves play without dying, you don't get the gold. For example, if it returns to someone's hand with Undo or is trashed somehow. If it's "destroyed" or "sacrificed" you do get the gold, because destroying or sacrificing a unit causes it to die.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If Plague Lab adds a second insurance rune to a unit, that doesn't let you collect insurance money twice. The insurance rune itself doesn't actually do anything—it's just a tangible marker and memory aid.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you have two Insurance Agents in play insuring the same unit, you can get double the gold and cards when it dies (since their abilities work independently).
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If Insurance Agent is insuring a unit, then you make something else a copy of that Insurance Agent, the copy will NOT also be insuring the unit. When you make something a copy of something else, it doesn't arrive so no arrive triggers happen. The copy does not get to put the insurance rune anywhere, and the rest of the copy's ability is looking for where that particular rune went. Because the copy never put a rune anywhere, the copy is not insuring anyting at all.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Justice Juggernaut
rules_text_1: Unstoppable but can't patrol. (Can ignore patrollers when attacking.)
rules_text_2: Two Lives (If this would die, heal all damage on it and put a crumbling rune on it instead. While it has a crumbling rune, it can really die.)

rulings.ruling: If this doesn't have a crumbling rune on it and it would die, it doesn't actually die so nothing that triggers on "dies" will happen. For example, it won't draw a card if it "would die" in the technician slot, only when it really does die after it has a crumbling rune on it.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Arresting Constable
rules_text_1: ⤵ → Disable a tech 0, I, or II unit. (Exhaust it and it doesn't ready during its next ready step. Sideline it if it was patrolling.)

name: Censorship Council
rules_text_1: Opponents can't play more than one card from hand during their turns. (This doesn't include hiring workers.)

rulings.ruling: The restriction doesn't apply to effects that would "put a card into play" such as from Feral Strike or Sanatorium.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Lawbringer Gryphon
rules_text_1: Your base gains flying. (Ground forces without anti-air can't attack it.)
rules_text_2: Flying, resist 2 (Opponents must pay ② each time they would ◎ this with a spell or ability.)
rules_text_3: Obliterate 4 (Whenever this attacks, destroy the defender's four lowest tech units first.)

rulings.ruling: Your base is no longer flying if you lose Lawbringer Gryphon.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Boot Camp
rules_text_1: Exhaust a unit or non-Peace hero and put a +1/+1 rune on it. (Sideline it if it was patrolling.)
rules_text_2: Draw a card.

rulings.ruling: You CAN use this on something that's already exhausted. The exhaust isn't a cost here, so you do as much as you can.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Elite Training
rules_text_1: Up to two of your units and/or heroes get +1 ATK, +1 armor, anti-air, and sparkshot until your next upkeep.

name: General's Hammer
rules_text_1: Deal 3 damage to a building.

name: The Art of War
rules_text_1: Your Peace Hero is unstoppable, has swift strike, and gets +2 ATK/+2 armor until your next upkeep.

name: Brave Knight
rules_text_1: Readiness (Doesn't exhaust to attack, but can only attack once per turn.)
rules_text_2: Whenever Brave Knight would die from combat damage, return him to his owner's hand instead.

rulings.ruling: Combat damage includes damage done while attacking or getting attacked while patrolling. It also includes damage from the overpower and sparkshot keywords as well as damage from the Tower add-on.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: When something "deals damage in the form of" something else, such as -1/-1 runes from Plague Spitter, Orpal Gloor, or Poisonblade Rogue, they really did "deal combat damage." Immediately after their form of damage is dealt, check if their victim would die. If yes, that victim counts as "dying from combat damage." Brave Knight will return to his owner's hand in this case.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Drill Sergeant
rules_text_1: Whenever you play a unit from your hand, put a +1/+1 rune on this.
rules_text_2: Remove a +1/+1 rune → Put a +1/+1 rune on another unit.

rulings.ruling: Playing a spell from your hand that summons units such as Murkwood Allies or Summon Skeletons does NOT count as "playing a unit from your hand."
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Using a spell or ability to "put a unit into play" from your hand does not count as "playing it from your hand."
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Flagstone Spy
rules_text_1: Invisible (To opponents without a detector, he's untargetable, unattackable, and can sneak past patrollers. While patrolling, he's attackable.)
rules_text_2: Whenever Flagstone Spy deals combat damage to a building, look at that player's hand and steal ① from them.

rulings.ruling: His ability that steals gold can't steal any against an opponent that doesn't have any gold.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Debilitator Alpha
rules_text_1: As squad leader: Units attacking Debilitator Alpha get -1 ATK.

name: Air Hammer
rules_text_1: Flying
rules_text_2: +2 ATK when attacking damaged buildings.

name: Flagstone Garrison
rules_text_1: Whenever you play a unit from your hand, draw a card.

rulings.ruling: Playing a spell from your hand that summons units such as Murkwood Allies or Summon Skeletons does NOT count as "playing a unit from your hand."
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: Using a spell or ability to "put a unit into play" from your hand does not count as "playing it from your hand."
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Patriot Gryphon
rules_text_1: Flying, resist 2 (Opponents must pay ② each time they would ◎ this with a spell or ability.)
rules_text_2: Unstoppable by units with 2 ATK or less.
rules_text_3: Whenever Patriot Gryphon destroys a building, he also deals his ATK to that opponent's base.

rulings.ruling: As an example, if Patriot Gryphon attacks a tech II building, he'll destroy that tech building because he deals 6 damage to it. As usual, that tech building being destroyed deals 2 damage to its controller's base. Then, because of Patriot Gryphon's ability, he'll deal an additional 6 damage to that same base.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Free Speech
rules_text_1: Silence an opponent. (Their heroes can't cast spells and lose all abilities until after that opponent's next turn.)

rulings.ruling: Opponents can still level up their heroes even if they are silenced. Heroes that reach the next band of levels still heal their damage even if their controller is silenced.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you use Free Speech on an opponent and that opponent plays a new hero on their next turn (in which they are still silenced), that new hero loses all abilities and can't cast spells.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: A hero that "loses all abilities" from the silence effect can't get new abilities either. For example, it can't be granted anti-air or sparkshot from Elite Training, though it can be granted +1 ATK and 1 armor from that same spell because those are stats and not "abilities."
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: When the silence effect ends, that players heroes are now able to have abilities again. (Imagine the abilities written on their character card are erased during the silence effect, then appear again when the duration ends.)
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: A silenced opponent can still play spells using Cinderblast Dragon or Guargum, Eternal Sentinel
rulings.author: sharpo

name: Hallucination
rules_text_1: Up to two tech 0, I, or II units are Illusions this turn. (Illusions die when they're ◎ by spells or abilities.)

name: Dreamscape
rules_text_1: Channeling (Stays in play. Sacrifice it when you lose your Truth hero.)
rules_text_2: All tech 0, I, and II units are Illusions. (Illusions die when they're ◎ by spells or abilities.)

name: Mind Control
rules_text_1: Attach to a tech 0, I, or II unit. You control it.

rulings.ruling: If the unit dies, it and Mind Control each go to their OWNER'S discard pile. That means Mind Control probably goes to yours and the unit probably goes to an opponent's discard pile.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If Mind Control is destroyed (by Nature Reclaims, for example), the unit returns to whoever controlled it before it was Mind Controlled.
rulings.author: Sirlin

rulings.ruling: If you Assimilate an a Mind Control, now you control the attached unit.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Spectral Flagbearer
rules_text_1: (Illusions die when ◎ by spells or abilities.)
rules_text_2: Whenever an opponent plays a spell or ability that can ◎ a flagbearer, it must ◎ a flagbearer at least once.

rulings.ruling: If you aren't able to target an opposing Flagbearer for any reason, you don't have to. That includes if the Flagbearer has "resist 1" and you have no gold. In that case, you can't target it with a spell or ability because you can't afford to pay the cost for resist, so you can ignore the Flagbearer and target something else.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Spectral Hound
rules_text_1: (Illusions die when ◎ by spells or abilities.)

name: Macciatus, The Whisperer
rules_text_1: Your Illusion units get +1/+1 and no longer die when they are ◎ by spells or abilities.

name: Reteller of Truths
rules_text_1: (Illusions die when ◎ by spells or abilities.)
rules_text_2: The first two times each turn one of your non-token Illusion units dies (including this one), return it to its owner's hand.

rulings.ruling: The ability triggers from a unit dying, so it means that unit really did die. Anything that triggers from a unit dying really will trigger, such as drawing a card if the unit died when it was in the technician slot.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Spectral Tiger
rules_text_1: (Illusions die when ◎ by spells or abilities.)

name: Spectral Roc
rules_text_1: (Illusions die when ◎ by spells or abilities.)
rules_text_2: Flying

name: Eyes of the Chancellor
rules_text_1: Detector, haste
rules_text_2: Opponents play with their hands revealed.
rules_text_3: ⤵ → Make a friendly unit invisible until your next upkeep.

name: Liberty Gryphon
rules_text_1: (Illusions die when ◎ by spells or abilities.)
rules_text_2: Flying, haste
rules_text_3: Unstoppable, unattackable, and untargetable while you control an Illusion with any other name than Liberty Gryphon.

rulings.ruling: If you control a Liberty Gryphon and Mirror Illusion copy of Liberty Gryphon, those both have the name "Liberty Gryphon." If you don't control any Illusions other than those, then your Liberty Gryphons do not get the keywords: unstoppable, unattackable, untargetable.
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Building Inspector
rules_text_1: The first building each opponent builds each turn costs ① more to build.

rulings.ruling: This effect applies to tech buildings and add-ons as well as building cards. This effect also applies to rebuilding tech buildings (if it's the first thing they build/rebuild in a turn, it will cost 1 instead of 0.)
rulings.author: Sirlin

name: Spectral Aven
rules_text_1: (Illusions die when ◎ by spells or abilities.)
